meanings.definition: To make someone or something famous or remembered forever.
meanings.sent1: The artist wanted to immortalize their pet in a painting.
meanings.sent2: The author hoped to immortalize their novel through widespread publication.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to immortalize their signature dish by naming it after their grandmother.
meanings.sent4: The photographer aimed to immortalize the beauty of the sunset in a breathtaking photograph.
meanings.sent5: The singer's powerful performance immortalized the song in the hearts of the audience.

meanings.definition: To preserve the memory of someone or something for eternity.
meanings.sent1: The historian sought to immortalize the ancient ruins through detailed documentation.
meanings.sent2: The museum's exhibit aimed to immortalize the culture of a bygone era.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that they would immortalize their embarrassing moment in a stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: The poet's words immortalized the love story in a timeless sonnet.
meanings.sent5: The film director's masterpiece immortalized the struggles of a generation on screen.
